0mR8Ksya97Bcrhn-Gq_1pg.text: Ordered the full breakfast and fresh orange juice, both very tasty. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the sausage was delicious (and I'm not usually a sausage person), and the service was wonderful. The waitress was super about my friend and I pretty much camping out for a few hours while we waited to be able to check into our hotel. It's also a really cute street to hang out on for a while, beautiful buildings and lots of shops to look at if you're seated outside. Definitely recommend.

25D5slRU2PuqfVgHkBHGpg.text: Don't miss a meal at this wee little restaurant tucked into the curve of Cockburn Street. The Italian food served out of their kitchen is top-notch. Everything from the decor to the wine list to the presentation is well-considered. They also offer a blackboard of daily specials in addition to their regular menu. My choices were from the specials. I started with a bowl of stracciatella soup with cheese tortellini and artisanal bread. The soup was perfectly hot when it arrived. The broth was seasoned well and totally delicious. Even the bread was nicely toasted and dressed with olive oil, sea salt and a flurry of rosemary. As a main, I had the linguine with clams, prawns and roasted cherry tomatoes. The pasta was lovely--al dente and savory with a touch of the wonderful shellfish flavors melded in. Expertly paired with a dry Pinot Grigio. For dessert, you won't regret ordering the tiramisu--it is creamy, fluffy and absolutely heavenly. Service was friendly, welcoming and accommodating. A gem in Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Linguine with clams, prawn and roasted cherry tomatoes--a daily special.
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Stracciatella with artisanal bread--a daily special

zkVOPsdMU9wdxeNgRa5Mwg.text: We had a wonderful meal at this gem of a restaurant. The bruschetta was crispy with succulent cherry tomatoes. My husband had the spinach and cheese ravioli which he declared to be excellent. I had linguine with two large meatballs and well seasoned tomato sauce. It was fabulous! It is a very small restaurant and the tables are close together. Still, it was not boisterous at all. It made for a lovely night out.

5EaZoiXBzMqP9AvEJVqkxQ.text: We loved this cozy Italian restaurant! Between our group we ordered spaghetti and meatballs, lasagna, ravioli, chicken, and linguini. All of our meals were delightful and very generous portions. We only wish we had saved room for dessert! The cakes in the display case looked wonderful. Service was good and the staff friendly. Definitely a great place to eat in Edinburgh!

fUkss3-PtC4xPiOHISo2Tw.text: We stumbled into this wonderful restaurant after a very long train ride into Edinburgh. The service is wonderful, the food is excellent and the ambiance is perfectly charming. Liked it so much that we went back the next night.  Don't miss this little gem!

jhfUCwDMXff65z0esMhORQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by La Locanda. I got the Filled Morning Rolls with three fillings (eggs, Cumberland sausage, and mushrooms) - for less than 6 pounds. The sausage was incredible and I got a good amount of food considering how little I paid for it!

photos.caption: Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Filled morning rolls with sausage, egg, and mushrooms
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

UVCm-JABfofoFZxTHoASOg.text: I came here after perusing previous Yelp reviews, their online menu and a craving for Italian. Their restaurant is very cute and cozy, definitely what you'd expect from an authentic Italian restaurant. There is also outdoor seating for prime people watching. The set up alone gets five stars, unfortunately that's where the accolades end.   I paid 20 for a lunch size portion-8 puny pieces-of ravioli and a glass of off-brand Rose. What in the inflation hell? It would not have been so bad if the ravioli weren't so tiny and lacking in flavor. These were seriously the puniest ravioli I'd ever seen, and they were barely stuffed with any spinach. I had originally wanted their mushroom ravioli, which looked and sounded glorious on their website. But they didn't have any ready for lunch. Okay cool, I want to have space to savor some of the limoncello cheesecake that they have featured on their menu, but oops, they don't have any of that ready, either. Seriously?? I understand small businesses have to make do, but if it's ON the lunch menu that you've placed before me, why isn't it available?? So frustrating. They offered me a sample of their 'cheesecake bar', which was essentially a lump of brown sugar. So now I've spent the equivalent of a 3 course dinner meal on an unfulfilling lunch. What's more infuriating is that there are PLENTY of eateries in this area that legitimately offer 3 course lunch and dinner for a fraction of what I paid. Ugh. Maybe dinner is the best time to visit, too bad I'll never know.   A quick word to management if you're reading: no one wants to hear you berate your new employee while trying to enjoy a meal. Maybe consider taking your administrative business off of the dining floor. Yes, it's your place, but it's very distracting and extremely off-putting.   Cheers!

okKMI-HyqlzETAI51sCiGw.text: Italian food on a cold wet Sunday night for dinner sounded perfect to me when my friend suggested La Laconda.   This place is a cute bistro that has a romantic and cozy atmosphere. The tables are small, but the place can accommodate a group perfectly fine since the tables can be easily moved around.   The menu is fairly simple. They offer about 4-5 different types of small plates and only 4 different mains from their menu: spaghetti with meatballs, Italian sausage, chicken Milanese, frittata. They did offer 3 additional mains from their special which were all written out on a chalkboard. With my indecisiveness I chose the spicy Italian sausage.   The dish came out awesome. It had tons of vegetables, 2 Italian sausages laid on top of a bed of spinach and 4 slices of focaccia bread. The sausages were very flavourful as a result of the various spices it contained. Though the sausages were split in half, the outer part of the sad sausages had a snap when I bit it. The salad wasn't anything special but it was the perfect pairing with the sausage since it brought a coolness to the spice. The focaccia bread were cut in small pieces and were crunch outside but chewy inside.   I decided not to get dessert, but instead get a hot chocolate. I ordered their special hot chocolate that came with marshmallows and a chocolate flake. The hot chocolate was rich but not overly dense and the marshmallows definitely made it richer and over the top. I couldn't finish it and ended up sharing it with my friend.   The only disappointment I had was the fact that they didn't have my favourite Italian red wine- Sangiovese. First Italian restaurant I went to that didn't have any or ran out. Gutted... Oh well, maybe next time!  I like this place because the food was on point, the staff were nice and helpful, and the decoration as well as the set up of the restaurant made me forget I was in Edinburgh but transported somewhere else. For that, I give this restaurant a thumbs up since most restaurant can't easily do that!

photos.caption: Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lwIwSW8NFC44FLZVQyo8zw.text: Easy, cheap lunch while exploring Edinburgh. If you are looking for a quick bite (panini, salad, etc.) and a cup of coffee, stop here for an easy, tasty lunch.  Paninis come pretty thin, but definitely quickly and hit the spot after a day of walking around. Sit outside and people watch while you eat!

ldjuRTpBln3omBbJJQLV7g.text: I visited La Locanda twice in less than an hour and a half. On my first visit, I was alone and ordered a cappuccino.  I was greeted with the warmest smile and made to feel so welcome. Cappuccino was lovely and I managed to avoid the amazing selection of cakes. (DIET 1: CAKE 0)   I met my friend and we decided to pop in for lunch. Again, we were greeted warmly (there was a chorus of 'You're back!!') and we both chose to order paninis (9.00 each). I had one with tomato and mozzarella which was delicious. I really enjoyed the accompanying salad which comes with a balsamic dressing.   It's a really cute, cosy place and the staff do a great job. I'd definitely recommend popping into La Locanda!

photos.caption: Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. All the cake!
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Counter area.
Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino

Nv5MuezRd2RODCcI17lcWQ.text: Excellent food, great atmosphere, and wonderful service.  Small intimate restaurant that still feels casual.  I ordered the lasagna, my husband the meatballs, and both were great.  Definitely recommend!

N90BvRfb3AXypBZHhLT6PA.text: Very delicious and authentic Italian food in the heart of Edinburgh. The service was excellent and I cleaned my plate. The arrancini and gnocchi were amazing. If we go back to Edinburgh we are definitely going back. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is there.

dVD2nfBxjXjJyKLYxPkpTA.text: Great food and friendly service. Really nice cozy atmosphere in the area. Nice place to have some wine and tapas or a full meal.

gM_ZrhQ7plVFg6QhwORhlw.text: First thing, you probably need a reservation.  We got in without but I saw them turn away several people without a reservation. Started with bruschetta which was very tasty. The bread was soaked with oil but still crispy.  Great lasagna and the wife really liked the ricotta and spinach stuffed ravioli. Ended with chocolate and fudge cheese cake....wow.

photos.caption: Photo of La Locanda - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu

yvtGksjOWNg7sJnLqtXCXA.text: What a nice place to tuck in for a bite and to be pampered. The restaurant is tiny and on a side street off the Royal Mile. It is very clean and spare but not at all unwelcoming. It was cold, damp and rainy outside but we were greeted with a smile that was very warm. I had a porcini mushroom and potato soup that was delicious. The rosemary in the soup was a lovely touch. Joe had the bruschetta and devoured every morsel. The balsamic vinegar was syrupy and dense and totally incredible. The olives were fresh and firm. The waitstaff was so accommodating, we had the lasagna and they prepared an order of spaghetti and meatballs that was not on the menu that night for me and Joe to split. They did not seem annoyed by the request and actually suggested that we split the entrees so we could sample each other's dish without any fuss. Both entrees were wonderful. Fresh and flavorful and ample portions. We could not eat dessert but the desserts looked great. The biggest thing I remember from the meal was how kind the staff was to everyone in the restaurant. Smiling and gracious to everyone. The meal was excellent but the staff made the experience for me.

HRo_Oi7WGV0iP9y07DnOug.text: I just nipped in here for a quick glass of vino with my pals who were already dining there. When I walked through the door, it was like I was late for my own party, a gent, maybe the manager, greeted me at the door with open arms and everyone welcomed me with a smile. I'm not sure that everyone gets this favourable welcome but it's worth a try and if not, you can still revel in the heartwarming food and cosily lit atmosphere!

OTzdCjrl6UXnTtupijAhmQ.text: Terrific, authentic Italian. Service was superb. You know the chef cares about quality when the balsamic on the rocket garnish is amazing. If you're a foodie, you'll appreciate this tiny restaurant.

iXvWIzwqQb20Za1ZTh3pEA.text: Excellent preparation, great service in a small busy place. Had a focaccia, excellent with grilled veggies, tasty and wife had a meatball appetizer, also excellent. Desert was ice cream with chocolate sauce, a nice touch.

fzhcbjh-4h1NBIY-GDRbLw.text: We walked in here after not being able to get into the wine bar down the street -- and were very glad we did! It is cozy, welcoming, and the waitress was wonderful. It is a small operation (often the cook came out to hand the food to our waitress!) but we felt very well taken care of. We both ordered off the specials menu -- my mom got the ravioli with truffle butter and sage and I ordered the soup (beef tortellini) and panini special. The pasta was fresh and everything was delicious. Perfect for a cold Edinburgh night!

0A2gG2nRW5SlzJs7dcNkYw.text: Looked at Yelp for a spot to grab dinner while in Edinburgh. Did a short walk over to this place after seeing the reviews. They could not accommodate a party of three at the moment and said that if I wait a bit perhaps something would open up, so I opted to wait it out as most places were booked up. While waiting I sat on a bench outside. I asked the waiter (who knew I was waiting to see if a table opened up as he was the one I spoke with) for the wifi password so I could text my two friends and update them and he informed me it was only for customers and that I shouldn't even be sitting on the bench as technically that is for customers too (no one else was even on it or waiting). Basically he kicked me out of the perimeter of the place. I really don't get it. I'm not one to blame racism usually as that is a hand sometimes over dealt, but given how he acted with the white customers next to me versus me, I'm really at a loss. At a minimum horrible service. Too bad, or perhaps not; the food looked crappy from what I could see during my short "unlawful" seating.

MBASj-csrKGYT1fjme3BWQ.text: Excellent food, and even better service. Greatly appreciate their gluten free options and ability to accommodate my GF diet. We both had the frittata and it was delicious.
